com.othersonline.kv.backends
Class MemcachedKeyValueStore

java.lang.Object
  com.othersonline.kv.BaseKeyValueStore
      com.othersonline.kv.BaseManagedKeyValueStore
          com.othersonline.kv.backends.MemcachedKeyValueStore
All Implemented Interfaces:
KeyValueStore, ManagedKeyValueStore
public class MemcachedKeyValueStore
extends BaseManagedKeyValueStore
implements KeyValueStore

Proxy to the spy memcached client. Comments are copied from javadoc for that client.

Author:
sam

exists

public boolean exists(String key)
               throws KeyValueStoreException,
                      IOException
Description copied from interface: KeyValueStore
Determine whether or not a given key exists. On backends that do not provide native support for this primitive (memcached, tokyo tyrant) we will call get() and compare to null. This may be a more expensive operation than you would like.

Specified by:
exists in interface KeyValueStore
Specified by:
exists in class BaseKeyValueStore
Throws:
KeyValueStoreException
IOException

incr

public long incr(String key,
                 int by,
                 long def)
Increment the given counter, returning the new value.

Parameters:
key - the key
by - the amount to increment
def - the default value (if the counter does not exist)
Returns:
the new value, or -1 if we were unable to increment or add

                 int by,
                 long def,
                 int exp)
Increment the given counter, returning the new value.

Parameters:
key - the key
by - the amount to increment
def - the default value (if the counter does not exist)
exp - the expiration of this object
Returns:
the new value, or -1 if we were unable to increment or add

                 int by,
                 long def)

key - the key

def - the default value (if the counter does not exist)
Returns:
the new value, or -1 if we were unable to decrement or add

Returns:

getUnavailableServers

public Collection<SocketAddress> getUnavailableServers()
Get the addresses of unavailable servers. This is based on a snapshot in time so shouldn't be considered completely accurate, but is a useful for getting a feel for what's working and what's not working.

Returns:
collection of currently unavailable servers

getVersions

public Map<SocketAddress,String> getVersions()
Get the versions of all of the connected memcacheds.

Returns:
map of server version on all hosts
